intro: Tabernaemontana guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and unique floral structure. However, it is important to note that the plant contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
